reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wonderful stay in the Sabina aprtment. It was very peaceful, the staff were very helpful and the apartment to a high standard. The private transfers are worth teh money as it is a long journey from Dalaman and the water / sweets much appreciated! Kalkan is a short walk from Elvina (10 mins) but there is a bit of a hill so it wont suit everyone. The walk was well worth it to have such a great view. The private (shared btwn 2 apartments) are well worth the money.
reviews.title: Couln't fault it

reviews.text: the viola apartment at the elvina collection had it's own small infinity pool which made it really special although the front patio was quite small for four guests the views were stunning over the bay of kalkan.tha aparments were well equipped but blackout curtains in the bedrooms would have improved the sleep quality.Joe and Sarah , the serviceand guest director were excellent ,Enes was brilliant and very efficient he opened the kitchen for us and the quality of the food was very good it was a shame more people didn't use it.Guests need to be aware that the roads leading to the elvina are very steep and partly unmade and poorly lit at night we used a lot of taxis!
reviews.title: as a very well travelled person with high expectations wow!!

reviews.text: We booked our holiday with The Turquoise Collection and stayed in the Elvina complex (Maia apartment, with its own infinity pool) and it was one of thebest holidays we have ever had. The stunning location (albeit up a very steep hill) and the gorgeous split level apartments were everything we hoped for, and the view was to die for. By the end of the holiday we were managing the hills quite easily although we did resort to the odd taxi or two, especially when we were carrying shopping to cook in our very modern, extremely well equipped kitchen ( taxes were cheap and plentiful) The apartments were cleaned regularly, fresh linen/towels every few days and the main pool and bar area were spotless. Kalkan is a delightful place and we would thoroughly recommend it for anyone looking for a genuine Turkish holiday.
reviews.title: The whole thing was fabulous

reviews.text: We are here as I write this staying in the Maia Apartment which has a shared infinity pool set above the main pool. This is a heavenly place - I wake up each morning and sit outside watching the sun rise over the mountains to our left, looking out to sea and wondering how little I can do again today! Pool is superb, apartments are lovely if a little sparse - a coffee maker would be nice as would a tea pot. Beds are on the firm side. Come here if you want to relax and enjoy the views - Kalkan is a special place and we will be returning as soon as we can. Staff are lovely and the poolside is classy. You will get fitter if you stay here - the hill is steep and the steps are many! Wonderful place and grat value for what you get.
reviews.title: Stunning location set above Kalkan with views to die for - heaven!

reviews.text: We stayed in Piera penthouse for seven days in August.
reviews.title: Comfortable stay, all you need

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Apartment Madelaine - When you first arrive, you just want to keep looking around and take in those magnificent views available from all three of the balconies in the apartment (although back bedroom apartment only a side view). You can wake up in the double room to sweeping views of the bay and the town. Very adequately furnished apartment, Big fridge and freezer, washing machine, dishwasher, flat screen tv, dvd, satelite. Nice furnishings, 2 bathrooms (shower only) one upstairs and one down. A few basic things provided, (but take a couple of dishwasher tabs with you for convenience) salt, pepper and milk for your first day. I found the kitchen contained everything you could need with plenty of glasses, plates etc. But the nicest thing about the apartment is the great (semi-private) infinity pool accessed from the sizeable private terrace to the front of the living room (shared with just the the next door apartment) with stunning views and comfortable loungers. The terrace loses the sun at about 3-4pm and the balcony pool loses it about 4-5pm, but the communal terrace with huge communal pool and plenty of loungers keeps the sun until about 6-7pm. The views from everywhere are just breathtaking. You could of course pick minor faults with the apartments if you tried really hard, but I thought they were magnificent and can't see how anyone would not be totally overjoyed when they arrived.The hill to the aprtment is steep and taxis are quite expensive, but you are not too far from town and we walked to and from most places (including market and bus stop quite nearby by going left rather than down the hill from elvina) and back without too much problem. Although I could see this being a problem for some people so the taxi price of about £3-4 e/w wold have to be taken into account. We paid £595/wk through turquoise collection for the apartment plus 250 deposit for damage, The same Tapestry package with flights transfers etc. seemed a little expensive and by doing the package ourselves we saved over £600 (we took buses rather than private transfers...very cheap). One negative, the few staff on-site are not that helpful and have no knowledge of the area at all, this opinion seemed to be shared by other guests who did luckily have lots of helpful advise on Kalkan, so that is your best bet. The on-site bar is reasonably priced, but we didn't try the food so can't comment. the six downstairs apartments have access to their own shared infinty pools from the balcony which are big pools. Each pair of apartments sharing one and the main shared pool is huge. this really is a fantastic apartment, I strongly reccommend it, you won't be disappointed.
reviews.title: Such a great place to relax and the views........wow!

reviews.text: We stayed here for week 2 of our 3 week trip, with 2 young children. I dont think the apartments with the shared infinity pools are suitable for young children as they have a 6-18 foot drop over the side (also not private as advertised but shared between 2 apartments), dont think penthouses would be suitable either as, but we stayed in the Elena apartment which had steps leading from our very large private balcony (on 2 sides of the apartment so sun all day) into the communal pool - albeit the deep end.
reviews.title: Good location, innovative design
Kalkan, the place to go for good food, location and value for money
reviews.text: The apartment was spacious, air con worked well. Main negaive was the poor finishing of tiling, lights and the stinkey drain in the bathroom shower - just took the edge off what could have been really luxurious.

reviews.title: Really lovely place with really lovely people.
reviews.text: Thankfully we had a car, there is no way we would have braved the walk to the beach or the restaurants as the hills are incredibly steep. We didnt particularly like Kalkan as it was incredibly busy for such a small picturesque place and full of Brits. But it was great for a base to get to Patara, Letoon, Xanthos, Kekova, Kas, Goeck, Salkikent....
